meanings.definition: Fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: She kept renigging on her promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He renigged on his agreement to meet for lunch.
meanings.sent3: The cat was renigging on its duty to catch mice.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be renigging on its promise to shine all day.
meanings.sent5: The student's excuses for renigging on submitting the assignment were unconvincing.

meanings.definition: To go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: They were renigging on their plan to visit the museum.
meanings.sent2: After promising to help, she renigged at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The dog was renigging on its decision to stay in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of renigging on his campaign promises.
meanings.sent5: The company risked losing trust by renigging on their offer to match donations.
